title: API endpoints reference
text: Use tce_catalog(search = "...") locate endpoint interest. Use tce_params("Endpoint") discover available query parameters. Use tce_fields("Endpoint") see output schema. call corresponding wrapper function (listed ) call tce_request("Endpoint", ...) directly API parameter names.

title: API endpoints reference
code: tce_params("Contratos") tce_fields("Contratos")  tce_contracts(codigo_efisco_ug = "510101", ano_contrato = "2025")

title: Exploring endpoints, parameters, and fields
text: Filter keyword:
code: library(tceper)  tce_catalog() tce_catalog(search = "licit")

title: Exploring endpoints, parameters, and fields
text: Pick endpoint name tce_catalog(). instance, LicitacaoUG:

title: Exploring endpoints, parameters, and fields
text: api_name exact query name expected API. r_name snake_case name can pass R wrapper.
code: tce_params("LicitacaoUG")

title: Exploring endpoints, parameters, and fields
code: tce_fields("LicitacaoUG")

title: Exploring endpoints, parameters, and fields
text: know parameters exist, can query snake_case arguments (package maps api_name internally).
code: tce_bids(anomodalidade = "2025")

title: Exploring endpoints, parameters, and fields
text: tceper validates query parameters endpoint catalog. pass parameter exist endpoint, aborts shows allowed parameter list. avoid , inspect allowed parameters first:
code: # Example (invalid parameter name for this endpoint): tce_contracts(fog = "510101", verbose = TRUE) tce_params("Contratos")

title: Exploring endpoints, parameters, and fields
text: Many wrapper functions can cache results -memory faster repeated calls. can inspect cache state : clear : verbose = TRUE, cache hits may print short message indicating returned object comes cache.
code: tce_cache_info() tce_cache_clear()

title: Getting started with tceper
text: tceper R client TCE-PE (Tribunal de Contas Estado de Pernambuco) Open Data API. package wraps official endpoints user-friendly functions : accept snake_case arguments (mapped API’s expected query names), return tibbles (optional snake_case output column names).

title: Getting started with tceper
code: # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("StrategicProjects/tceper")

title: Getting started with tceper
code: library(tceper)

title: Getting started with tceper
text: Filter keyword:
code: tce_catalog() tce_catalog(search = "contrat")

title: Getting started with tceper
code: tce_params("Contratos")

title: Getting started with tceper
code: tce_fields("Contratos")

title: Getting started with tceper
text: Municipios endpoint exposed tce_municipalities(). can filter state (UF) municipality name:
code: tce_municipalities() tce_municipalities(unidadefederativa = "PE") tce_municipalities(municipio = "Recife")

title: Getting started with tceper
text: can add additional filters. Use tce_params("Contratos") see allowed.
code: tce_contracts(codigo_efisco_ug = "510101") tce_contracts(codigo_efisco_ug = "510101", ano_contrato = "2025")

title: Getting started with tceper
text: Fornecedores endpoint exposed tce_suppliers().
code: tce_suppliers(cpfcnpj = "25173110000186") tce_suppliers(nome = "eireli")

title: Getting started with tceper
text: verbose = TRUE, package prints: final API URL, helper commands inspect inputs/outputs endpoint.
code: tce_bids(anomodalidade = "2025", verbose = TRUE)

title: Getting started with tceper
text: default, output columns converted snake_case. keep original names API:
code: tce_municipalities(clean_names = FALSE)

title: Getting started with tceper
text: API returns 100,000 records per request. limit reached, tceper issues warning. work around , apply filters narrow query:
code: # Avoid unfiltered requests that may hit the 100k limit: # tce_municipal_expenditures()  # Choose a municipality code: library(dplyr) library(stringr)  tce_municipalities() |>   filter(str_detect(municipio, "Pesqueira")) |>   glimpse() # Rows: 1 # Columns: 5 # $ codigoibge        <chr> "2610905" # $ codigo            <chr> "P113" # $ unidadefederativa <chr> "PE" # $ municipio         <chr> "Pesqueira" # $ codigosagres      <chr> "5408"  # Filter by municipality and year: tce_municipal_expenditures(   codigo_municipio = "P113", # Pesqueira   ano_referencia   = "2025" )

title: Getting started with tceper
text: prefer call endpoint directly, use tce_request() pass API query names (shown tce_params()):
code: tce_request("Contratos", CodigoEfiscoUG = "510101", AnoContrato = "2025")

title: Getting started with tceper
text: wrapper functions cache results memory. default TTL 1 hour. can change TTL globally:
code: tce_contracts(codigo_efisco_ug = "510101")  # hits the API tce_contracts(codigo_efisco_ug = "510101")  # instant (from cache)  # Bypass cache tce_contracts(codigo_efisco_ug = "510101", cache = FALSE)  # Inspect and manage tce_cache_info() tce_cache_clear() options(tceper.cache_ttl = 7200)  # 2 hours

title: Authors and Citation
text: Andre Leite. Author, maintainer. Marcos Wasilew. Author. Hugo Vasconcelos. Author. Carlos Amorin. Author. Diogo Bezerra. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Leite , Wasilew M, Vasconcelos H, Amorin C, Bezerra D (2026). tceper: Access Open Data API Pernambuco Court Accounts. R package version 0.1.2, https://github.com/StrategicProjects/tceper.
code: @Manual{,   title = {tceper: Access the Open Data API of Pernambuco Court of Accounts},   author = {Andre Leite and Marcos Wasilew and Hugo Vasconcelos and Carlos Amorin and Diogo Bezerra},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.1.2},   url = {https://github.com/StrategicProjects/tceper}, }

what: tceper: R interface to the TCE-PE Open Data API
title: tceper: R interface to the TCE-PE Open Data API
text: tceper R client TCE-PE (Tribunal de Contas Estado de Pernambuco) Open Data API. package wraps 71 API endpoints user-friendly functions accept snake_case parameter names return tibbles. built-catalog lets discover endpoints, inspect input parameters output fields — without leaving R.

title: tceper: R interface to the TCE-PE Open Data API
code: # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("StrategicProjects/tceper")

title: tceper: R interface to the TCE-PE Open Data API
code: library(tceper)  # 1. Discover endpoints tce_catalog() tce_catalog(search = "contrat")  # 2. Inspect parameters and output fields tce_params("Contratos") tce_fields("Contratos")  # 3. Query (use snake_case or the original API names) tce_contracts(codigo_efisco_ug = "510101")

title: tceper: R interface to the TCE-PE Open Data API
text: querying endpoint, can explore built-catalog directly R.

title: tceper: R interface to the TCE-PE Open Data API
code: tce_catalog() #> # A tibble: 71 × 4 #>    endpoint               group          title                         url #>    <chr>                  <chr>          <chr>                         <chr> #>  1 ReceitasEstaduais      Receitas       Receitas Estaduais            … #>  2 ReceitasMunicipais     Receitas       Receitas Municipais           … #>  …  tce_catalog(search = "licit")

title: tceper: R interface to the TCE-PE Open Data API
code: tce_params("Contratos") #> ── Contratos has 23 parameters: ────────────────────────────── #> ℹ unidade_gestora, unidade_orcamentaria, esfera, … #> ── Dictionary ──────────────────────────────────────────────── #> # A tibble: 23 × 5 #>    api_name      r_name          required type      description #>    <chr>         <chr>           <lgl>    <chr>     <chr> #>  1 UnidadeGesto… unidade_gestor… FALSE    character Unidade Gestora #>  …

title: tceper: R interface to the TCE-PE Open Data API
code: tce_fields("Contratos")

title: tceper: R interface to the TCE-PE Open Data API
text: Use snake_case names (r_name) original API names — work:
code: # These are equivalent: tce_contracts(codigo_efisco_ug = "510101") tce_contracts(CodigoEfiscoUG = "510101")  # Add more filters tce_contracts(codigo_efisco_ug = "510101", ano_contrato = "2025")

title: tceper: R interface to the TCE-PE Open Data API
text: verbose = TRUE, package prints final API URL helper commands inspecting endpoint: Enable globally:
code: tce_contracts(codigo_efisco_ug = "510101", verbose = TRUE) #> ℹ API URL: https://sistemas.tce.pe.gov.br/DadosAbertos/Contratos!json?CodigoEfiscoUG=510101 #> ℹ To inspect this endpoint: #>     - Input parameters: tce_params("Contratos") #>     - Output fields: tce_fields("Contratos") options(tceper.verbose = TRUE)

title: tceper: R interface to the TCE-PE Open Data API
text: 71 wrapper functions cache results memory, keyed endpoint + parameters. Default TTL 1 hour.
code: tce_contracts(codigo_efisco_ug = "510101")       # hits the API tce_contracts(codigo_efisco_ug = "510101")       # cache hit (instant) tce_contracts(codigo_efisco_ug = "510102")       # different key → hits the API  tce_contracts(codigo_efisco_ug = "510101", cache = FALSE)  # force fresh  tce_cache_info()    # inspect cached entries tce_cache_clear()   # clear all

title: tceper: R interface to the TCE-PE Open Data API
text: package validates query parameters catalog. pass parameter doesn’t exist endpoint, aborts helpful error listing allowed parameters:
code: tce_contracts(xyz = "foo") #> ✖ Unknown query parameter(s) for endpoint Contratos: xyz #> ℹ Allowed parameters: #>   • unidade_gestora (UnidadeGestora) #>   • codigo_efisco_ug (CodigoEfiscoUG) #>   …

title: tceper: R interface to the TCE-PE Open Data API
code: options(   tceper.verbose  = TRUE,   tceper.progress = FALSE,   tceper.cache_ttl = 7200 )

title: tceper: R interface to the TCE-PE Open Data API
text: API returns 100,000 records per request. limit reached, package issues warning. Use filters narrow query:
code: tce_municipal_expenditures(   codigo_municipio = "P113",   ano_referencia   = "2025" )

title: tceper: R interface to the TCE-PE Open Data API
text: prefer pass API parameter names directly, use tce_request():
code: tce_request("Contratos", CodigoEfiscoUG = "510101", AnoContrato = "2025")

what: Clear the tceper in-memory cache — tce_cache_clear
title: Clear the tceper in-memory cache — tce_cache_clear
text: Removes cached API responses subsequent calls hit API . default clears everything; use pattern selectively clear entries specific endpoints.

title: Clear the tceper in-memory cache — tce_cache_clear
code: tce_cache_clear(pattern = NULL)

title: Clear the tceper in-memory cache — tce_cache_clear
text: pattern Optional regex pattern clear matching keys. NULL (default), clears entire cache. example, "Contratos" clears cached contract queries.

title: Clear the tceper in-memory cache — tce_cache_clear
text: Invisibly returns number entries cleared.

title: Clear the tceper in-memory cache — tce_cache_clear
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ tce_cache_clear()              # clear everything tce_cache_clear("Contratos")   # clear contract queries only } # }

title: Show cache status — tce_cache_info
text: Returns tibble describing currently cached entries, including cache key (endpoint + parameters), row count, timestamp age. Useful understanding cached expire.

title: Show cache status — tce_cache_info
code: tce_cache_info()

title: Show cache status — tce_cache_info
text: tibble columns key, rows, cached_at age_secs, empty tibble cache empty. cache TTL controlled getOption("tceper.cache_ttl", 3600).

title: Show cache status — tce_cache_info
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ tce_cache_info() } # }

title: List available API endpoints — tce_catalog
text: Returns tibble listing 71 endpoints available TCE-PE Open Data API, group, description URL. Use search filter keyword.

title: List available API endpoints — tce_catalog
code: tce_catalog(search = NULL)

title: List available API endpoints — tce_catalog
text: search Optional character string filter endpoints name description (case-insensitive). example, search = "licit" returns procurement-related endpoints.

title: List available API endpoints — tce_catalog
text: tibble columns endpoint, group, title, url.

title: List available API endpoints — tce_catalog
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ tce_catalog() tce_catalog(search = "contrat") tce_catalog(search = "municipio") } # }

what: Perform a request to the TCE-PE Open Data API — tce_request
title: Perform a request to the TCE-PE Open Data API — tce_request
text: Low-level function sends GET request TCE-PE Open Data API returns response content tibble. Higher-level wrapper functions tce_contracts(), tce_state_expenditures(), etc. call function internally. can use tce_request() directly access API endpoint, including yet dedicated wrapper.

title: Perform a request to the TCE-PE Open Data API — tce_request
code: tce_request(   endpoint,   ...,   clean_names = TRUE,   max_tries = 3,   progress = getOption("tceper.progress", TRUE),   verbose = getOption("tceper.verbose", FALSE) )

title: Perform a request to the TCE-PE Open Data API — tce_request
text: endpoint character string API method name (e.g., "Contratos", "DespesasEstaduais"). See https://sistemas.tce.pe.gov.br/DadosAbertos/Exemplo!listar full list available endpoints. ... Named query parameters passed API exactly API expects (typically CamelCase). NULL values silently dropped. See API documentation parameter names. clean_names TRUE (default), column names converted snake_case via janitor::clean_names(). Set FALSE keep original column names returned API. max_tries Maximum number retry attempts failed requests (default: 3). Passed httr2::req_retry(). progress TRUE, displays progress messages via cli::cli. Defaults value getOption("tceper.progress"), TRUE unset. verbose TRUE, prints final API URL console performing request. Useful debugging testing. Defaults getOption("tceper.verbose", FALSE).

title: Perform a request to the TCE-PE Open Data API — tce_request
text: tibble response content. Returns zero-row tibble records found.

title: Perform a request to the TCE-PE Open Data API — tce_request
text: https://sistemas.tce.pe.gov.br/DadosAbertos/

title: Perform a request to the TCE-PE Open Data API — tce_request
text: TCE-PE API uses Struts2-style URLs ! invokes method (e.g. Contratos!json). URL built paste0() preserve literal ! — using httr2::req_url_path_append() encode %21, causing server ignore query parameters.

title: Perform a request to the TCE-PE Open Data API — tce_request
text: API returns 100,000 records per request. limit reached, warning issued suggesting use additional filters.

title: Perform a request to the TCE-PE Open Data API — tce_request
text: API responds ISO-8859-1 encoding, converted UTF-8 internally.

title: Perform a request to the TCE-PE Open Data API — tce_request
text: tceper.progress — set FALSE suppress progress messages. tceper.verbose — set TRUE always print final API URL. tceper.cache_ttl — cache time--live seconds (default: 3600).

title: Perform a request to the TCE-PE Open Data API — tce_request
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Direct query to any endpoint tce_request("Contratos", CodigoEfiscoUG = "510101")  # Show the final URL for debugging tce_request("Contratos", CodigoEfiscoUG = "510101", verbose = TRUE)  # Keep original column names tce_request("Municipios", clean_names = FALSE) } # }

what: Retirement, pension and reform outcomes — tce_retirement_outcomes

what: tceper: Access the Open Data API of TCE-PE — tceper-package
title: tceper: Access the Open Data API of TCE-PE — tceper-package
text: R interface Open Data API Tribunal de Contas Estado de Pernambuco (TCE-PE), Court Accounts State Pernambuco, Brazil. Provides tidy, ready--use functions query public data revenues, expenditures, commitments, procurement, contracts, agreements, public works, legal processes, personnel reference tables state municipal government entities Pernambuco.

title: tceper: Access the Open Data API of TCE-PE — tceper-package
text: Discover endpoints tce_catalog() (filter search =). Inspect input parameters tce_params() output fields tce_fields(). Query using wrapper function (e.g. tce_contracts()) low-level tce_request().

title: tceper: Access the Open Data API of TCE-PE — tceper-package
text: query parameters passed ... using names shown tce_params(). can use either original API name (e.g. CodigoEfiscoUG) snake_case equivalent (e.g. codigo_efisco_ug); package maps automatically.

title: tceper: Access the Open Data API of TCE-PE — tceper-package
text: tceper.verbose TRUE, functions print final API URL. Default: FALSE. tceper.progress FALSE, suppresses progress messages. Default: TRUE. tceper.cache_ttl Cache time--live seconds. Default: 3600 (1 hour).

title: tceper: Access the Open Data API of TCE-PE — tceper-package
text: Maintainer: Andre Leite leite@castlab.org Authors: Marcos Wasilew marcos.wasilew@gmail.com Hugo Vasconcelos hugo.vasconcelos@ufpe.br Carlos Amorin carlos.agaf@ufpe.br Diogo Bezerra diogo.bezerra@ufpe.br

title: tceper 0.1.2
text: Removed duplicate .tce_catalog() definition. function defined catalog.R (-memory caching) introspection.R (without caching). uncached version introspection.R loaded second silently overrode cached version, causing JSON catalog re-parsed every call. Now cached version catalog.R used. Fixed double .tce_map_params() call tce_cache_key(). Parameter names mapped twice, harmless wasteful.

title: tceper 0.1.2
text: Rewrote README.md complete sections: quick start, catalog exploration, verbose mode, cache, parameter validation, options table, API limits. Improved tceper-package.R full package-level documentation including workflow, parameter names, options. Fixed vignette getting-started: corrected record limit 10,000 100,000 typo “municapality” → “municipality”. Updated _pkgdown.yml: added print methods tceper-package reference index. Fixed DESCRIPTION: replaced placeholder pkgdown URL actual site URL. Updated NEWS.md reflect current API (parameter names without leading dots, translated parameter names).

title: tceper 0.1.1
text: Fixed critical URL encoding bug: httr2::req_url_path_append() percent-encoding ! character Struts2-style URLs (Contratos!json → Contratos%21json), causing API server ignore query parameters return unfiltered results. URL now constructed directly via paste0() passed httr2::request(), preserving literal ! separator (#1).

title: tceper 0.1.1
text: -memory cache 71 wrapper functions parameter-aware cache keys. unique combination endpoint + parameters gets cache entry. example, tce_contracts(codigo_efisco_ug = "510101") tce_contracts(codigo_efisco_ug = "510102") cached separately. TTL defaults 1 hour; configurable via options(tceper.cache_ttl = <seconds>). tce_cache_clear() — clear pattern-matched cached entries. tce_cache_info() — inspect current cache contents age. functions accept cache = FALSE force fresh request. verbose parameter functions. TRUE, prints final API URL (query parameters) making request. Also shows helper commands tce_params() tce_fields(). Can set globally via options(tceper.verbose = TRUE). Endpoint catalog introspection. New functions discovering API without leaving R: tce_catalog() — list endpoints search support. tce_endpoint() — get metadata single endpoint. tce_params() — list input parameters api_name r_name. tce_fields() — list output fields. Parameter validation mapping. Query parameters validated catalog. Invalid parameter names trigger helpful error listing allowed parameters. Users can pass snake_case names (e.g. codigo_efisco_ug) automatically mapped API’s expected names (e.g. CodigoEfiscoUG).
